title: Refactor watch logic to allow testing of watched paths
description: Extract the logic for determining which paths to watch into a separate function so we can verify that the config file is included in the watch list via unit tests.
close_reason: Function extracted and test added in commit b073b6d

title: Syntax highlighter parsing bug: stops at first > closing pre tag
description: The highlight_html parser looks for the first '>' to find the end of the opening tag, but this stops at '<pre>' instead of '<code class="language-*">'. Result: the <code...> tag is fed into the highlighter as text content instead of being parsed as markup.
close_reason: Fixed by adjusting tag parsing to skip <pre> and find the closing > of <code> tag

title: Pass all_content variable to templates for tags counting
Add watch subcommand for live rebuilds
description: Add marie-ssg watch command that monitors src/ and templates/ directories for changes and automatically triggers a rebuild when files change. This enables a faster development workflow without manually re-running build after each edit.
close_reason: Implemented watch subcommand with fsevent for macOS

title: Watch mode doesn't reload on config file changes
description: The watch mode currently only watches content_dir, template_dir, and static_dir. It should also watch the config file itself (e.g., site.toml) so that changes to configuration (like site title, etc.) trigger a rebuild.

title: Fix watch mode not reloading templates
close_reason: Fixed by creating fresh template environment on each watch rebuild

title: Syntax highlighter escaping bug: HTML entities rendered literally
description: The markdown parser HTML-escapes content in code blocks (e.g., '<' becomes '<'). The highlighter receives this escaped content and renders it literally, so code containing HTML shows '<' instead of '<'.
close_reason: Fixed by unescaping HTML entities (<, >, &, etc.) before passing code to the syntax highlighter
